title: 🗃️ Poor hive ventilation
description: One of the most critical challenges faced by beekeepers is poor hive ventilation, which can have significant implications for the health and productivity of a colony. Bees naturally regulate the temperature and humidity within the hive to ensure the survival of their brood and the proper functioning of the hive. However, inadequate airflow can lead to excessive moisture buildup and heat, creating an environment that promotes disease and stress. This, in turn, weakens the colony, makes them more susceptible to pests like mites, and affects their ability to forage effectively.
